alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Marion; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 11:20PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Sequatchie, Marion and southwestern Hamilton Counties through 115 AM EST/1215 AM CST/... At 1220 AM EST/1120 PM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of South Pittsburg, or 9 miles northwest of Bridgeport, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Dunlap, Jasper, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, South Pittsburg, Walden, Whitwell, Kimball and Monteagle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EST/500 AM CST/ for east Tennessee.
